result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda L. Howard

records.addlTxt:
11:12 AM/ RM 203.  Defendant Amanda L. Howard appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Case was to be called on 10/24, but was rescheduled for today as Court was overbooked. Court notes status of counsel report. Def. continues to wish for counsel. Court notes bond modification filed by Def. and was sent to Judge's JA for review. State has complied with victims rights.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

for Bond Reduction
Routed to Judge's JA

3:04 PM/ RM 301.  Defendant Amanda L. Howard appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history and appointment of counsel Report. Def. continues to wish for counsel and requests to address bond. Court denies as needs to be in writing and heard by Judge Rhode. Court questions if Def. would like to go past time limits for P.H. Def. would like to go past time limits and wait for counsel. Court accepts waiver of time limits. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:23 PM Defendant Amanda L. Howard appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail. Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews PD status of counsel. Def. continues to wish for counsel. Court agrees Def. needs counsel and finds good cause to go past time limits. State has complied with victim rights.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No contact with alleged victim or victims residence.
Def. not to possess any credit cards that are not in Def. name.

10:32 AM Defendant Amanda L. Howard appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own or court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. is waiting for counsel and still wishes for an Atty. Court finds good cause to go past time limits. Def. questions charges. Court responds. State is in compliance with victim rights, was originally set for initial appearance on 9-12-22. State makes bond recommendations and requests $1,000.00 cash bond with conditions of no contact with alleged victim or victims residence and Def. not to possess any credit cards that are not in Def. name. Def. makes statement regarding bond. Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond with conditions of no contact with alleged victim or victims residence and Def. not to possess any credit cards that are not in Def. name.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
